name: Identify lines and angles in two-dimensional figures

skills.name: Identify rays, lines, line segments, angles and points

explanations.A: This diagram shows an object that is straight and goes infinitely in both directions (as shown by the arrows), which is in fact a line.
explanations.B: Although this diagram is straight like a line, it has endpoints, which a line does not. Which other diagram is straight and continues on forever?
explanations.C: Close! This diagram is straight and continues forever in one direction, but a line continues forever in both directions. Which diagram best showcases this?
explanations.D: This diagram continues on in two directions like a line, but it is not straight. Which diagram continues forever in two directions and is straight?

explanations.A: Close! This diagram is straight and ends in one direction, but a line segment has an ending in both directions. Which diagram best showcases this?
explanations.B: This diagram shows an object that is straight and ends in both directions (as shown by the points), which is in fact a line segment.
explanations.C: Although this diagram is straight like a line segment, it has arrows showing it goes on forever in both directions, which a line segment does not. Which other diagram is straight and ends in both directions?
explanations.D: Remember a line segment is a straight object that has two distinct endpoints. Which diagram best showcases this?

explanations.A: Remember that line segments must be straight with two endpoints.
explanations.B: I think you have chosen 1 since Z appears to be made of one continuous line. Remember that line segments must be straight with two endpoints.
explanations.C: I think you have identified how many angles it takes to make up the letter Z. How many line segments does it take it make it?
explanations.D: A line segment is a portion of a straight line marked by two endpoints. To make the letter Z, we would need: one line segment horizontal on the bottom, one slanting from the bottom left to top right, and one more horizontal on top. This would tally to 3 total line segments.

explanations.A: Remember that line segments must be straight with two endpoints.
explanations.B: I think you have chosen 2 since A appears to have one horizontal line segment and one angle, appearing like this: É…. Remember that line segments must be straight with two endpoints.
explanations.C: A line segment is a portion of a straight line marked by two endpoints. To make the letter A, we would need: one line segment slanting up from left to right, one slanting up from right to left, and one more horizontal in the middle. This would tally to 3 total line segments.
explanations.D: You may have thought that the top of the A is a line segment, when it actually is just the intersection of two line segments. If we take that out of our total, how many line segments make up the letter A?

explanations.A: Remember that a line is straight object with no ending in either direction. How many lines make up this diagram of railroad tracks?
explanations.B: A line is an object that is straight and goes infinitely in both directions (as shown by the arrows). This railroad track diagram has one on top and one on bottom, so 2 overall.
explanations.C: Remember that a line segment is straight with two endpoints, while a line is straight with no ending. How many lines make up this diagram of railroad tracks?
explanations.D: Remember that lines and line segments are different. Lines continue on forever, while line segments have endpoints. How many lines are in this diagram?

explanations.A: Remember that a line is straight object with no ending in either direction. How many lines make up this diagram of a road?
explanations.B: Remember that a line segment is straight with two endpoints, while a line is straight with no ending. How many lines make up this diagram of a road?
explanations.C: Remember that lines and line segments are different. Lines continue on forever, while line segments have endpoints. How many lines are in this diagram?
explanations.D: A line is an object that is straight and goes infinitely in both directions (as shown by the arrows). This road diagram has one on top and one on bottom, so 2 overall.

explanations.A: I think you may have mixed up parallel and perpendicular lines. Which of these sets are perpendicular?
explanations.B: Remember that perpendicular lines intersect at an exact right angle. Which of these diagrams matches that description?
explanations.C: Remember that perpendicular lines intersect at an exact right angle. Which of these diagrams matches that description?
explanations.D: The two lines shown here intersect at exactly a right angle, which means they are a set of perpendicular lines.

explanations.A: Remember that perpendicular lines intersect at an exact right angle. Which of these diagrams matches that description?
explanations.B: It looks like you may have thought that perpendicular means "going in opposite directions." Remember that perpendicular lines intersect at an exact right angle. Which of these diagrams matches that description?
explanations.C: The two lines shown here intersect at exactly a right angle, which means they are a set of perpendicular lines.
explanations.D: It looks like you may have thought that perpendicular means "lines that do not touch." Remember that perpendicular lines intersect at an exact right angle. Which of these diagrams matches that description?

explanations.A: Remember that an angle is the space created between two intersecting lines or line segments, and obtuse angles are greater than 90 degrees.
explanations.B: I think you may have mixed up acute and obtuse angles. How many obtuse angles are in the letter Y?
explanations.C: The letter Y is made up of one angle smaller than 90 degrees, and two angles greater than 90 degrees. So we have 1 acute angle and 2 obtuse angles.
explanations.D: You have correctly identified how many angles in total there are in the letter Y, but that is not the question. How many of these angles are obtuse?

explanations.A: The letter X is made up of two angles smaller than 90 degrees, and two angles greater than 90 degrees. So we have 2 acute angles and 2 obtuse angles.
explanations.B: I think you may have only looked at one of the sides of the letter X. Be sure to check every angle and see how many are obtuse...
explanations.C: I think you may have only looked at the top and bottom of the letter X. Be sure to look at the side as well. How many obtuse angles make up the letter X?
explanations.D: You have correctly identified how many angles in total there are in the letter X, but that is not the question. How many of these angles are obtuse?
